actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned. The next meeting is scheduled for 10:00 a.m. on June 21, 2023.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Jackson (IL) moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.

actions-list.header: NOTIFICATION OF INTENT TO OFFER RESOLUTION
actions-list.actionItem: Mrs. Boebert notified the House of her intent to offer a privileged resolution pursuant to clause 2(a)(1) of rule IX. The Chair announced that a determination will be made at the time designated for consideration of the resolution.

actions-list.header: NOTIFICATION OF INTENT TO OFFER RESOLUTION
actions-list.actionItem: Mrs. Luna notified the House of her intent to offer a privileged resolution pursuant to clause 2(a)(1) of rule IX. The Chair announced that a determination will be made at the time designated for consideration of the resolution.

Mr. Alford asked unanimous consent That it may be in order at any time on Thursday, June 22, 2023, for the Speaker to declare a recess, subject to the call of the Chair, for the purpose of receiving in joint meeting His Excellency Narendra Modi, Prime Minister of the Republic of India. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.
Considered by unanimous consent. H. Res. 523 — "Authorizing video recording in the House Chamber during a joint meeting of Congress for certain educational purposes."
Mr. Alford asked unanimous consent to discharge from committee and consider.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 409
actions-list.actionItem: 0, 1 Present (Roll no. 273).

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 3672 — "To designate the clinic of the Department of Veterans Affairs in Indian River, Michigan, as the "Pfc. Justin T. Paton Department of Veterans Affairs Clinic"."

The Chair announced that the unfinished business was the question on the motion to suspend the rules and pass H.R. 3672, which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 407
actions-list.actionItem: 0 (Roll no. 272).
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 1606 — "To amend the Small Business Act to codify the Boots to Business Program, and for other purposes."

The Chair announced that the unfinished business was the question on the motion to suspend the rules and pass H.R. 1606, as amended, which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of June 20.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for approximately 6:30 P.M. today.

actions-list.header: The Speaker laid before the House a message from the President transmitting a notification stating that the national emergency with respect to North Korea that was declared in Executive Order 13466 of June 26, 2008 is to continue in effect beyond June 26, 2023
actions-list.actionItem: referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs and ordered to be printed (H. Doc. 118-49).

actions-list.header: The Speaker laid before the House a message from the President transmitting a notification stating that the national emergency with respect to the Western Balkans that was declared in Executive Order 13219 of June 26, 2001 is to continue in effect beyond June 26, 2023
actions-list.actionItem: referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs and ordered to be printed (H. Doc. 118-48).

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3672.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Bost moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 3672 — "To designate the clinic of the Department of Veterans Affairs in Indian River, Michigan, as the "Pfc. Justin T. Paton Department of Veterans Affairs Clinic"."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 30.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Bost moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 30 — "To authorize major medical facility projects for the Department of Veterans Affairs for fiscal year 2023, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1606.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Ellzey moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 1606 — "To amend the Small Business Act to codify the Boots to Business Program, and for other purposes."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of June 20.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.
The Chair designated Ms. Garcia of TX to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by Dr. Barry C. Black, U.S. Senate, Washington, DC.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of June 20.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 2:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 2:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Andrew R. Garbarino to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
